section.section: The purpose of the Corps Board is to advise the Trust in the development and implementation of the Corps Program.

If a regulated lobbyist is appointed to serve as a member of the Corps Board, the lobbyist is not subject to:
§ 15-504(d) of the State Government Article; or
§ 15-703(f)(3) of the State Government Article as a result of that service.

text.section: A member of the Corps Board shall reside in the State.

In making appointments to the Corps Board, the Governor shall consider:
Diversity; and
All geographic regions of the State.

A member of the Corps Board:
May not receive compensation as a member of the Corps Board; but
Is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.

section.section: The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of the members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members on July 1, 2010.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The appointing authority may remove a member for incompetence, misconduct, or failure to perform the duties of the position.

section.section: The Corps Board shall determine the times and places of its meetings.
The Corps Board may act with an affirmative vote of six members.
